60 countries in bold typeface are low-income developing countries (LIDC) and 94 countries in regular typeface are emerging market countries (EMC). The LIDCs are countries eligible for the IMF’s concessional financial assistance with a per capita gross national income (measured according to the World Bank’s Atlas method) in 2011 of below twice the IDA’s effective operational cut-off level, and Zimbabwe. The EMCs are the non-LIDC emerging market and developing countries. 34 countries, with an asterisk, are included in the World Bank’s list of countries in fragile situations, as of
56 emerging market and developing countries are fuel or primary commodity exporters
